channel.title: Training Log on Quakkels.com
channel.description: Recent content in Training Log on Quakkels.com

item.title: 22 (HLM)
item.description:
Today I started a new approach with Heavy/Light/Medium (HLM.)

Heavy Day

Squats

  • 45x5
  • 135x5
  • 225x5
  • 315x3
  • 325x1
  • 340lbs for 3 sets of 5

Squats were prescribed to be 5x5, but I changed it once the workout was underway because it was taking so long, and it felt heavy.

Overhead Press

  • 45x5
  • 95x5
  • 135x3
  • 155x1
  • 157.5lbs for 3 sets of 5

Press was prescribed for 5x5. Decided to change it to 3x5 just like squat. Work sets were planned to be 160lbs but I misloaded the bar and forgot a 2.5 on one side.

Left shoulder has felt tweaked since last week. Hopefully today’s workout helped loosen it up.

Deadlift

  • 135x3
  • 225x3
  • 315x3
  • 365x1
  • 405lbs for 1 set of 4.

I was supposed to lift a set of 5. I’m not used to full body workouts and over-estimated what I could pull at the end of this workout.

For future workouts I might switch back to the 5x3 scheme from Persistence. Though, I’ll try and make it through a week or two with 3x5 first.

item.title: 21 (Persistence)
item.description:
Bench Day

Superset 1

Lift LBs Sets Reps
Bench 240 2 3
Pendlay Row 240 2 3

I failed the first rep of my third set. And my left shoulder felt tweaked. Decided to call it a day and not push it.

item.title: 20: R/Strongman Challenge (Persistence)
item.description:
R/Strongman Challenge Day (Usually deadlift day)

Got an 18” Deadlift gym PR with a lift of 495lbs.

Superset

Lift LBs Sets Reps
SSB Squat 305 4 3
DB Step Up 50 4 6

item.title: 19 (Persistence)
item.description:
Overhead Press Day

Superset 1

Lift LBs Sets Reps
Overhead Press 175 5 3, 3, 3, 2, 3
Lat Pulldown 175 5 6

OHP will be kept at 175 until I can complete all 5 sets of 3 reps.

Superset 2

Lift LBs Sets Reps
DB Floor Flies 40 4 6
DB Seated Press 50 4 10, 10, 10, 7

Will keep DB Seated Press at 50 until I can complete all 4 sets of 10.

item.title: 18 (Persistence)
item.description:
Deadlift Day

Superset 1

Lift LBs Sets Reps
Squat 345 5 3
Ab Roller bw 5 10

Instead of doing my usual 18” deadlift superset I opted to attempt an entry into r/strongman’s 18” deadlift challenge. Unfortunately, I failed with 495lbs. It broke off the blocks, but I just couldn’t get it past my knees.

Might attempt 485 tomorrow or Sunday.

item.title: 17 (Persistence)
item.description:
Bench Day

Superset 1

Lift LBs Sets Reps
Bench 235 5 3
Barbell Row 235 5 3

Superset 2

Lift LBs Sets Reps
Axle Press 190 4 3
Isolation DB Curl 35 4 10

item.title: 16 (Persistence)
item.description:
Deadlift Day

Yay! Day two back on track.

Superset 1

Goal was to deadlift 405 for 5 sets of 3. But failed the third rep of the second set and had to back off a bit.

Deadlift: 3 at 405lbs, then 2 at 405lbs. Finished with 3 sets of 3 at 395lbs.

Superset with…

Ab Roller 5 sets of 10 with bodyweight.

Superset 2

Lift LBs Sets Reps
SSB Squat 295 4 3
DB Step Up 40 4 6

The program is getting heavy enough that I’m removing some of the supplemental work like the Pinch Block and Jumping Jacks. Those will get added back in next time I restart Persistence.

I had a grip PR today. A 385lb double overhand deadlift during warmups.

item.title: 15 (Persistence)
item.description:
Overhead Press Day

Getting back into the routine this week. Last week amounted to a full 7 days away from the gym. I was starting to feel a little run down anyway. The weights were feeling heavier than they should. So maybe the week off will do some good for my recovery.

Superset 1

Lift LBs Sets Reps
Overhead Press 170 5 3
Lat Pulldown 170 5 6

Ran out of time for the second superset. I really need to get in the gym on time and use rest timers to make sure I get everything in.

Started using a pronated and slightly narrower grip on the lat pulldown. Seems to feel nice.

item.title: 14 (Persistence)
item.description:
Bench Day

Conflicts in my schedule have caused me to miss a few days this week. I decided to skip ahead to bench day and modify it pretty heavily from what I usually do.

Bench: 230lbs 5x3
Barbell Row: 225lbs for 3. Then 245lbs for 2x3 (PR)

I am happy with the rowing. For the last several weeks I’ve used an axle bar. With an axle I end up being limited by grip. It was nice to see barbell rows being easier now. Happy to get the PR on an off day.

item.title: 13 (Persistence)
item.description:
Overhead Press Day

Superset 1

Lift LBs Sets Reps
Overhead Press 165 5 3
Lat Pulldown 165 5 6
Jumping Jacks bw 5 20

Didn’t have time to do the second superset.

item.title: 12 (Persistence)
item.description:
Squat Day

Superset 1

Lift LBs Sets Reps
Squat 345 5 3
Ab Roller bw 5 10
Jumping Jacks bw 5 20

Superset 2

Actually, I didn’t superset. Was feeling so dead at this point that I decided to drop the assistance stuff and only do the 18” deadlifts.

Lift LBs Sets Reps
18” Deadlift 415 4 3

415lbs for 3 reps is a PR.

item.title: 11 (Persistence)
item.description:
Bench Day

Superset 1

Lift LBs Sets Reps
Bench 225 5 3
Axle Row 175 5 5
Jumping Jacks bw 5 20

Superset 2

Lift LBs Sets Reps
Axle Press 190 4 3
Isolation DB Curl 35 4 10
50’ DB Suitcase Carry 80 4 1

item.title: 10 (Persistence)
item.description:
Deadlift Day

Superset 1

Lift LBs Sets Reps
Deadlift 385 5 3
Ab Roller bw 5 10
Jumping Jacks bw 5 20

These deadlifts felt very heavy. I’m going to watch my protein intake to see if I can continue this block’s linear progression. Though, I might reduce reps down to 2 instead of 3. Or, I might only train deadlifts once every two weeks. I’d probably put an axle clean in this slot during the off week. Not sure which I’ll go with when the time comes to make a change.

Superset 2

Lift LBs Sets Reps
SSB Squat 295 4 3
Pinch Block 50 4 3
Bi-Lateral Glute Raise bw 4 10

I thought SSB Squats after heavy deadlifts would destroy me. But the muscle groups are different enough that these felt surprisingly fresh. Definitely felt it in the quads. These also helped my hips feel great after those deadlifts.

item.title: 9 (Persistence)
item.description:
Overhead Press Day

Switching it up! Changing up the Persistence program from the first time I ran it. Instead of an upper and lower superset each day, I’m going to have an upper body day with two upper body supersets. Lower body days will have two lower body supersets. This hopefully will be easier to recover from.

Superset 1

Lift LBs Sets Reps
Overhead Press 160 5 3
Lat Pulldown 166 5 6
Jumping Jacks bw 5 20

Superset 2

Lift LBs Sets Reps
DB Floor Fly 35 4 6
Seated DB Press 50 4 8
50’ DB Suitcase Carry 80 4 1

item.title: 8 (Persistence)
item.description:
Squat Day

Superset 1

Lift LBs Sets Reps
Squat 335 5 3
Ab Roller bw 5 8
Jumping Jacks bw 5 20

Superset 2

Lift LBs Sets Reps
Axle Press 190 4 3
Pinch Block 47.5 4 3
DB Lunges 35 4 3

I’ve been liking the unilateral work a lot lately. Incorporating DB work is primarily for “prehab” to make sure all my joints have engaged stabilizers.

However, I’m still trying to figure out what I like for unilateral lower body work. Today was supposed to be Split Squats but I switched to lunges during the workout. Even though I used light dumbbells, it definitely felt good. My stabilizers engaged in my hips, which was the goal.
